pack.name: maryclient
pack.description: OpenMary Client: The Client to the OpenMary TTS system. You will need a client and a server to run the system on your machine. However, in certain circumstances, you may want to connect to a server running elsewhere, so you need only a client. This includes a client implementation in Java, accompanied with a GUI interface. Several simple example implementations in other programming languages are also included. This component is licensed under the BSD-style OpenMary license.

pack.name: english
pack.description: OpenMary English: Basic English synthesis. You will need an English voice component, e.g. english-kevin16. If you can accept a research license, you should also install the english-shprot component: It provides part-of-speech tagging which improves the prosodic realisation. This component is licensed under the BSD-style OpenMary license.

pack.name: english-kevin16
pack.description: OpenMary English male diphone voice. This basic US English diphone voice is taken from FreeTTS, and was originally created by Carnegie Mellon University. This component is licensed under the BSD-style FreeTTS license.

pack.name: tibetan
pack.description: OpenMary Tibetan: Basic Tibetan synthesis. This component is the result of a student project at Saarland University. It provides very basic synthesis of Tibetan (currently limited to Wylie transliteration) into speech. You will need a Tibetan synthesis voice -- until native Tibetan voices exist, you can use the package mbrola-tib-nl2 which uses a Dutch diphone voice as an approximation. Volunteers for further developing this component are welcome! The component may also illustrate the basics of creating a new language module in MARY. This component is licensed under the BSD-style OpenMary license.
